title: How to Make Carrot Bulgur Salad

steps.headline: Cook the bulgur in a heavy-based saucepan.
steps.description: Bring one cup of water to boil and then drop in the bulgur. Stir and reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover the saucepan and allow to simmer for 40 minutes. Keep an eye on the bulgur; if the water is absorbed earlier, test for readiness or add more water to prevent burning.

steps.headline: Remove bulgur and put to one side to cool slightly.
Combine the remaining ingredients in a large bowl.
Add the cooked bulgur and mix well.
Cover the bowl and place in the refrigerator.
steps.description: Leave for a minimum of one hour.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Provide a large ladle for easy serving straight to plates.

text: Cook the bulgur in a heavy-based saucepan. Bring one cup of water to boil and then drop in the bulgur. Stir and reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover the saucepan and allow to simmer for 40 minutes. Keep an eye on the bulgur; if the water is absorbed earlier, test for readiness or add more water to prevent burning. Remove bulgur and put to one side to cool slightly.  Combine the remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Add the cooked bulgur and mix well.  Cover the bowl and place in the refrigerator. Leave for a minimum of one hour. Serve. Provide a large ladle for easy serving straight to plates.
